page.title: 04Attitudes
page.content: A quite dramatic change has taken place within the survey area and it was decided to interview residents who had lived in the vicinity during the past 40 years. They were asked whether in their opinion, the area had changed for the better or not. Also they were asked to suggest one facility they thought would improve the level of amenities available. Of 100 adults questioned, 33 believed that the area had improved, being cleaner, less built up and more friendly than previously. 22 people thought that the area had deteriorated, the main reasons being that loss of industry meant loss of jobs and opportunities. The remainder believed that changes made little difference to community spirit or amenities available. The only noteable improvement was more open space. 75% wanted a bank.
